meanings.sent1: The spoilt fruit was no longer good to eat.
meanings.sent2: The spoilt toy had a crack in it.
meanings.sent3: The spoilt sandwich was squished in my bag.
meanings.sent4: The spoilt road was full of potholes.

meanings.sent1: The spoilt child always got what he wanted.
meanings.sent2: The spoilt pet had its own bed and toys.
meanings.sent3: The spoilt cake was covered in too much frosting.
meanings.sent4: The spoilt student never had to study.
meanings.sent5: The spoilt princess expected everything to be perfect.

meanings.definition: To have ruined or damaged something
meanings.sent1: He spoilt the surprise by telling her too soon.
meanings.sent2: The rain spoilt our picnic plans.
meanings.sent3: I spoilt the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: She spoilt the painting with a wrong brush stroke.
meanings.sent5: The noise spoilt the peaceful atmosphere of the garden.
